alert.note: Alert for Will (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 19 at 6:30PM CDT until further notice by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Illinois, including the following area, Will. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Underpasses may be flooded. Roads and streets may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 628 PM CDT, doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated up to 1 inch of rain has fallen due to thunderstorms. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible, especially near Joliet, New Lenox, and Manhattan. Ponded water on roadways will likely continue for at least the next hour. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Joliet, Naperville, Bolingbrook, Romeoville, Plainfield, Woodridge, Lockport, New Lenox, Crest Hill, and Shorewood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
